txt.en: TBD go forward into the camp

#-1:[placeholder]'Friends, truly, this [placeholder] is not one of those who aggrieved you. #-1:{She[f]|He[m]} is my guest and I vouch for #-1:{her[f]|him[m]}. Any harm done from hence be on my head.\n\n'Come, good [placeholder]. This was but a misunderstanding. They are angry, and with cause. But not at you. I see doubt in your eyes. The dead of two parties lie on the ground and you have not decided the meaning. You are not quick to judge, and that is well.'

You should investigate the refugee camp where the incident was said to have occurred.
You should talk to Enkárvo, the young Dorwinion man you met in Dale.
You should return to the centre of the refugee camp.
There are signs of a struggle here
'You thief, you desecrator! You'll pay!'
DNT go towards the eastern end of the camp
'Come with me then to my own camp, and we will see if you may judge slowly, and justly.'
You have come to the camps of the Easterling refugees, across the river from Dale, to look into word of an incident.
'Do you think us all unarmed and helpless?'
The place is desolate and quiet as the grave
'You should not have come back here.'
'Betrayer of trust!'
Instance: An Incident in the Camps
This Dale-man died amid a struggle
'You should not be allowed to live!'
This Easterling holds a weapon
'Hold back now. Let us attack all at once.'
'Please! Please, all of you, lower your arms!'
'This [placeholder] defended me from harm in Dale. I give you my word.'
'Grrrr.'
